application_type_full: Prior Approval: Change of use from Commercial, Business and Service (Use Class E) to Dwellinghouses (Use Class C3)
description: Change of use of the ground floor (Use Class E) into 1 self-contained flat (Use Class C3).  (Class MA, 56 Day Prior Approval Process)
decision_conditions: The proposal falls within the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 3, Class O of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015. As such, prior approval is required and granted. | The development permitted shall be completed before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and condition 5 of Schedule 2, Part 3, Class MA of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 as amended.
| The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:
Location Plan prepared by ReQuestaPlan, dated 22 April 2024,
Existing Ground Floor and Basement, Drawing No. 366-01, dated 28 August 2023,
Proposed Ground Floor and Basement, Drawing No. 366-05, Rev. A, dated 2 May 2024,
Proposed Cross Section, Drawing No. 366-08, Rev. A, dated 2 May 2024,
Planning Statement prepared by Planning Solutions (London) Ltd,

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended) and Class MA of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015, as amended. | Prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development, details of the cycle storage facilities shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include the number and capacity of the stores, the location of the stores and the materials for the store. The approved storage areas shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development and shall be permanently retained thereafter.

Reason:  Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage in accordance with policy and T5 of the London Plan (2021). | Prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved development, details of the refuse and recycling storage shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include the number and capacity of bins, the location of storage and the materials for the store. The approved storage shall be brought into use prior to the first use of the hereby approved development and shall be permanently retained thereafter.
Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policy SI 8 of the London Plan (2021).
